meanings.definition: Send or receive messages by telex.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys telexing important information to her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: He telexes the documents to the overseas office every week.
meanings.sent3: Telexing jokes to her friend always brings a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: In the digital age, telexing has become a vintage form of communication.
meanings.sent5: Telexing urgent updates ensures quick delivery of the message.

meanings.definition: The act of sending or receiving messages by telex.
meanings.sent1: The telexing of official memos is a common practice in the office.
meanings.sent2: We received the telexing from our partners confirming the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The telexing machine hummed softly in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a telexing station, constantly sending and receiving thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The telexing of news alerts kept the team informed and connected.
